derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English, from the base of Old English swīfan 'to move (along a course), sweep'

entry.def: If something swivels or if you swivel it, it turns around a central point so that it is facing in a different direction.

example.ex: She swivelled her chair round and stared out across the back lawn...
example.tran: 她把椅子转过来，向外凝视着屋后的草坪。

example.ex: His chairs can swivel, but they can't move up or down.
example.tran: 他的椅子能旋转，但是不能升降。

entry.def: If you swivel in a particular direction, you turn suddenly in that direction.

example.ex: He swivelled round to face Sarah.

entry.def: If your head or your eyes swivel in a particular direction or if you swivel them in a particular direction, you quickly look in that direction.

example.ex: Roger swivelled his head to look at her...
His eyes swivelled from one girl to the other.
example.tran: 他的目光在两个女孩身上打转。
